required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of AdimFlu-S 2011-2012 in Non-Elderly Adult and Elderly Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of a Trivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine, Formulation 2011-2012, in Non-Elderly Adult and Elderly Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the antibody response to each of the three influenza vaccine strains included in the licensed seasonal flu vaccine, as measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HAI) at 21 days post immunization in non-elderly and elderly subjects in compliance with the requirements of the current European Union (EU) recommendations for the evaluation of the immunogenicity for a new formulation of a licensed flu vaccine (CPMP/BWP/214/96).

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoint will be the seroprotection rate which is defined as the proportion of subjects with HAI titer ≥ 40.
primary_outcome.description: Serum samples will be tested for anti-hemagglutinin (HA) antibodies by hemagglutination inhibition (HAI).
